name: Automated Gmail Classification & Response System with GPT and WhatsApp Alerts
description:
This n8n template uses AI to automatically classify incoming Gmail messages into five categories and route them to the right people or departments. It can also reply automatically and send WhatsApp alerts for urgent or relevant messages.
This helps ensure high-priority emails never get missed, while other messages are handled efficiently.

##How It Works
1. Trigger
A new email in Gmail triggers the workflow.

2. Classification (OpenAI GPT)
The email is analyzed by an OpenAI GPT model and classified into one of:

High Priority
Customer Support
Promotion
Finance/Billing
Random/Other

3. Conditional Logic & Actions
High Priority ‚Üí Create draft reply + send WhatsApp alert.

Customer Support ‚Üí Auto-reply + send WhatsApp confirmation alert.

Promotion ‚Üí Summarize email + send WhatsApp promotional alert.

Finance/Billing ‚Üí Forward to finance team + send WhatsApp finance alert.

Random/Other ‚Üí Label and log only.

4. Multi-Channel Output
Responses are sent via Gmail.
Alerts are sent via WhatsApp (or another compatible API).

##Setup Instructions
Step 1: Gmail Authorization
Add a Gmail node in n8n.
Connect using OAuth2 and grant read/send permissions.

Step 2: OpenAI API Key
Get your API key from OpenAI.
Add it to n8n credentials for the OpenAI node.

Step 3: WhatsApp Integration
Use your WhatsApp Business API or a provider like Twilio or 360Dialog.

Replace placeholders with your details:

[YOUR_WHATSAPP_NUMBER]
[YOUR_FINANCE_TEAM_NUMBER]
[YOUR_SUPPORT_TEAM_NUMBER]

Step 4: Import & Run
Import the workflow JSON into n8n.
Adjust prompts, labels, and routing logic as needed.
Execute and monitor results.

##Good to Know
Fully customizable ‚Äî add or remove categories, adjust responses, and change alert channels.

Can be integrated with Slack, Discord, Trello, Notion, Jira, or CRM systems.

Scales easily across teams and departments.

##Requirements
Gmail account with OAuth2 credentials set up in n8n

OpenAI API key for classification and content generation

WhatsApp (or other messaging service) integration

Optional: Slack, Notion, CRM, or accounting tool integrations

##Customization Ideas
Create support tickets in Trello, Notion, or Jira from Customer Support emails.

Sync Finance emails with QuickBooks, Stripe, or Google Sheets.

Replace WhatsApp alerts with Slack or Discord messages.

Use Zapier/Make for cross-platform automations.

categories.description: Definition: Emails requiring immediate attention or action, often time-sensitive or involving urgent issues.  Examples: System outages, legal alerts, executive requests, critical deadlines, crisis management.
Definition: Emails related to addressing customer issues, questions, feedback, or service requests.  Examples: Complaint resolution, troubleshooting help, account inquiries, service feedback.
Definition: Marketing or sales emails designed to promote a product, service, event, or offer.  Examples: Newsletters, discounts, product launches, affiliate promotions.
Definition: Emails involving monetary matters, budgets, transactions, invoices, or financial reporting.  Examples: Invoices, salary slips, payment confirmations, expense reports, tax documents.

Definition: Emails that don‚Äôt clearly fall into the above categories ‚Äî often personal, spammy, or unrelated to business operations.  Examples: Internal memos without urgency, jokes, general announcements, social invites.

values.content:
=You are an Executive Assistant responsible for drafting accurate, clear, and professional responses to urgent and high-priority inquiries.

Here is the incoming email you are responding to:
{{ $('Gmail Trigger').item.json.snippet }}

Your task:
1. Read and understand the email content carefully.
2. Identify the main issue, request, or concern.
3. Provide a concise and effective response that directly addresses the matter.
4. Maintain a professional and respectful tone.
5. If additional action is needed, include a short next-steps section in the reply.

Output format (return exactly in this structure):
Subject: [A short and relevant subject line]
Message: [Your full, well-formatted email reply]

=You are an Executive Assistant responsible for drafting professional, accurate, and empathetic responses to all customer support inquiries.

Here is the incoming email you are responding to:
{{ $('Gmail Trigger').item.json.snippet }}

Your task:
1. Read and understand the customer‚Äôs inquiry fully.
2. Identify the customer's name from the email content, and address them by name at the start of the reply.
3. Provide a clear, concise, and helpful response that answers all questions or concerns raised in the email.
4. Maintain a polite, friendly, and professional tone throughout.
5. Avoid unnecessary filler words; focus on solving the customer's issue efficiently.
6. End the email with:
Best regards,
[YOUR_NAME]

(Replace [YOUR_NAME] with the actual sender‚Äôs name configured in the workflow.)

=You are an Executive Assistant responsible for handling finance-related inquiries and preparing concise summaries for the finance department.

Here is the incoming email you are responding to:
{{ $('Gmail Trigger').item.json.snippet }}

Your task:
1. Read and fully understand the email content.
2. Identify the key financial topic or request (e.g., invoice, payment confirmation, budget query, expense report, tax document).
3. Summarize the essential details clearly and accurately.
4. Keep the summary professional and free of unnecessary information.
5. Ensure the tone remains formal and business-appropriate.

Output format (return exactly in this structure):
Subject: [A short and relevant subject line]
Text: [A clear and concise summary of the finance-related email]

=You are an Executive Assistant responsible for summarizing all incoming promotional emails.

Here is the incoming email you are responding to:
{{ $('Gmail Trigger').item.json.snippet }}

Your task:
1. Read and understand the promotional email content.
2. Identify the key offer, product, service, event, or deal being promoted.
3. Include important details such as:
   - Offer type (discount, launch, announcement, etc.)
   - Expiry date or deadline (if mentioned)
   - Any special conditions or requirements
4. Exclude unnecessary or repetitive marketing language.
5. Keep the summary clear, concise, and actionable.

Output format:
Summary: [A short, well-structured summary of the promotional email]

parameters.textBody:
= You received a Finance related inquires:{{ $('Gmail Trigger').item.json.snippet }}

I have notified this to your finance department with this Reply email:{{ $('Finance Department').item.json.message.content.Email }}

parameters.content:
Starts the workflow when a new email is received in Gmail.
Ensure you've set up Gmail credentials and appropriate filters if needed.

Uses OpenAI to classify the incoming email into one of 5 categories:

High Priority

Customer Support

Promotion

Finance/Billing

Random/General

Adds "High Priority" label in Gmail

Generates a draft email using OpenAI

Sends a WhatsApp alert for urgent attention

Adds "Customer Support" label in Gmail

Generates a quick auto-reply using OpenAI

Sends WhatsApp confirmation for support interaction

Labels the email as "Promotion"

Summarizes the email content using OpenAI

Sends a WhatsApp promotional digest alert

Labels the email as "Finance/Billing"

Creates a summary using OpenAI

Sends the summary to the Finance Department via Gmail

Triggers a Finance Alert over WhatsApp

Labels unclassified emails as ‚ÄúRandom‚Äù

No further automation occurs, but emails are still organized
